byline.contributor: Stephen Castle reported from London, and Raphael Minder from Madrid. Isma’il Kushkush contributed reporting from Nairobi, Kenya.
byline.original: By STEPHEN CASTLE and RAPHAEL MINDER

abstract: Rwandan intelligence service head Karenzi Karake is being held in London after his arrest there on a European warrant caused diplomatic and political complaints; he is wanted in Spain on war crimes charges involving genocide.
lead_paragraph: The Rwandan intelligence chief, Karenzi Karake, is wanted on war crimes charges involving genocide and the killing of Spanish aid workers in the 1990s.

headline.main: Britain Holds Rwandan Spy Chief on War Crimes Warrant from Spain
headline.print_headline: Rwandan Spy Chief Is Held in Britain

snippet: The Rwandan intelligence chief, Karenzi Karake, is wanted on war crimes charges involving genocide and the killing of Spanish aid workers in the 1990s.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
